Making popcorn: Instead of popping traditional popcorn kernels in an oil-pot, microwave popcorn can be made by placing the kernels in a sealed bag with some oil or butter and heating them in the microwave until they pop.
Making hot butter: Butter can be melted in the microwave instead of using a saucepan or melting pot.
Making ice cream: By melting flavors such as chocolate or vanilla in the microwave and mixing with softened ice cream, different unique flavors can be created.
Making hot sauce: Instead of heating up the sauce in a saucepan, it can be heated in a microwave for a quick and easy preparation.
De-stoning fruit: Microwaves can be used to quickly remove the stones from fruit such as peaches, mangoes or plums.
